posts.name: Nicholas Carpenedo
posts.cooked:
I can’t get ADIS16448 to work with 2022 vscode. I’ve tried the example code on the WPILib Docs and from the ADIS16448 documentation . No matter what I do, I get a heading of zero. Is this gyro still supported? When I try to import the library, the project won’t build. Any workarounds for this?

Here’s my code: ADIS16448_IMU gyro = new ADIS16448_IMU(); SmartDashboard.putNumber(“Gyro”, gyro.getAngle()); // in robot periodic

link_counts.title: ADIS16448 IMU Board for FIRST Robotics [Analog Devices Wiki]
Gyroscopes - Software — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Thad House
posts.cooked: There’s a bug in the image causing it to not work. A new image should be available soon to fix the issue.

posts.name: Nicholas Carpenedo
posts.cooked: Ah ok. Anything I can do to jerry rig it in the mean time?

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: No, there is no easy workaround available.

posts.name: Nicholas Carpenedo
posts.cooked: Ok. Just curious, how soon can we expect a new image?

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: Hopefully later this week.  I don’t have an exact ECD.
